summary:
Dynamic, proactive geoscientist and petroleum engineer with a multi-decade track record of value delivery across the integrated hydrocarbon value chain, leading agile project teams to seamlessly collaborate across functions and disciplines.
I am differentiated by an innovative “structured creativity” mindset that leverages a uniquely broad skillset (from new business development through to oil and gas exploration and field development) into proactively identifying the critical issues in any given business challenge, identifying opportunity and systematically executing to generate value at all levels of hierarchy – from corporate down to individual assets.

profile_positions.description:
Responsibility for field (re)development of the multi billion barrel Icotea/Misoa heavy oil field. Previous development efforts (1994-1997) were unsuccessful for a variety of reasons (poor production performance, limited success in locating productive reservoir with new wells).
Key Challenges: generating the (company wide) energy & commitment to turn around a ‘lost cause’; solving key technical and logistical issues.
•	Turnaround of the heavy oil development through a 18-month, 11 well drilling & workover campaign, increasing production threefold, halving UTC and adding significant new reserves
• Key breakthroughs: locating productive reservoir ‘sweet spots’ through integrated three dimensional reservoir characterisation; lowering drilling costs by up to 40%, through ‘Drilling the Limit’ methodology
• Delivery of a revised field development plan for the heavy oil reservoirs
profile_positions.title: Team leader and Principal geoscientist - field development
